revised_title: Investigating the Mathematical Formulas for Railways Resistance and Power
tldr: The author, Dionysius Lardner, investigates the mathematical formulas for the resistances to the motion of carriages on railways and the power necessary to work them. He examines the motion of trains on level and inclined planes, the effect of friction, and the impact of changes in speed. Lardner also explores the impact of the ground-plan of the road and the pressure produced by a given velocity and load. Lastly, he discusses the estimation of the mechanical power needed to work a railway.
